religious_places.name: Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple
religious_places.description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, this ancient Hindu temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Located on the banks of the Shipra River, it is a major pilgrimage site, especially during the Kumbh Mela.
religious_places.details: The Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple, situated in the ancient city of Ujjain, is one of the most revered shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva. As one of the twelve Jyotirlingas, it holds immense spiritual significance for Hindus worldwide. The temple's unique feature is its self-manifested lingam, believed to be Swayambhu, deriving its power from within. The Bhasma Aarti, a pre-dawn ritual where the lingam is anointed with sacred ash, attracts thousands of devotees. The temple complex, adorned with intricate carvings, stands on the banks of the holy Shipra River, which enhances its spiritual ambiance. The temple is a focal point during the Simhastha Kumbh Mela, held every 12 years, drawing millions of pilgrims. Visitors can also explore the temple's historical significance, as it has been patronized by various dynasties, including the Marathas.

nearby_places.name: Shipra River Ghats
nearby_places.description: Sacred ghats along the Shipra River, ideal for spiritual baths and rituals, especially during festivals.

nearby_places.name: Kaliadeh Palace
nearby_places.description: A historic palace on an island in the Shipra River, known for its Persian architecture and scenic beauty.

nearby_places.name: Harsiddhi Temple
nearby_places.description: A revered Shakti temple dedicated to Goddess Annapurna, located near Mahakaleshwar.

nearby_places.name: Ram Ghat
nearby_places.description: A prominent ghat for evening aarti and spiritual activities, offering a serene view of the Shipra River.

religious_places.history: The Mahakaleshwar Temple dates back to ancient times, with references in the Puranas and texts like the Mahabharata. It was rebuilt and expanded by the Maratha rulers in the 18th century, particularly under Rani Ahilyabai Holkar. The temple has withstood invasions and remains a symbol of spiritual resilience.
religious_places.best_time_to_visit: October to March, with peak spiritual significance during Mahashivratri and Kumbh Mela.
religious_places.entry_fees: Free entry; special darshan and Bhasma Aarti may require tickets (approx. ₹200-₹500).

religious_places.name: Omkareshwar Jyotirlinga Temple
religious_places.description: Another of the twelve Jyotirlingas, this temple is situated on an island in the Narmada River, revered for its spiritual significance and scenic beauty.

religious_places.name: Sanchi Stupa
religious_places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this Buddhist stupa was built by Emperor Ashoka. It is a major pilgrimage site known for its historical and architectural significance.

religious_places.name: Taj-ul-Masajid
religious_places.description: One of the largest mosques in Asia, built during the Mughal era. Its stunning architecture and vast courtyard make it a significant Islamic worship site.

religious_places.name: Pashupatinath Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its unique eight-faced lingam, similar to the Pashupatinath Temple in Nepal.

religious_places.name: Sonagiri Jain Temples
religious_places.description: A cluster of Digambar Jain temples known for their serene ambiance and spiritual importance, attracting Jain pilgrims seeking salvation.

religious_places.name: Khajuraho Group of Monuments
religious_places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring Hindu and Jain temples built by the Chandela dynasty, renowned for their intricate erotic carvings.

religious_places.name: Chausath Yogini Temple
religious_places.description: An 11th-century Hindu temple dedicated to 64 Yoginis, located near Bhedaghat, known for its unique circular architecture and spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Shri Data Bandi Chhod
religious_places.description: A significant Sikh gurdwara commemorating Guru Hargobind’s release from Gwalior Fort, attracting devotees for its historical and spiritual importance.

religious_places.name: Birla Mandir
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi, built by the Birla family, known for its serene environment and modern architecture.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid
religious_places.description: A historic mosque built by the Farukhi dynasty, showcasing Mughal architecture and serving as a central place of worship for Muslims in the region.

religious_places.name: Ahilyeshwar Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, built by Ahilyabai Holkar, known for its riverside location along the Narmada and intricate architecture.

religious_places.name: Bhojeshwar Temple
religious_places.description: An incomplete but grand Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, built by Raja Bhoj, famous for its massive lingam and architectural grandeur.

religious_places.name: Ram Ghat Temples
religious_places.description: A series of Hindu temples along the Mandakini River, associated with Lord Rama’s exile, revered for their spiritual ambiance and mythological significance.

religious_places.name: St. Joseph’s Church
religious_places.description: A prominent Christian church known for its serene environment and Gothic-style architecture, serving the local Christian community.

religious_places.name: Mata Vaishno Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A major Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to Goddess Vaishno Devi, located in the Trikuta Hills. It attracts millions annually, accessible via a 14 km trek or helicopter from Katra.

religious_places.name: Amarnath Cave Temple
religious_places.description: A sacred Hindu site at 3,888 meters, known for the naturally formed ice Shiva Lingam. The annual Amarnath Yatra draws thousands of devotees during summer.

religious_places.name: Hazratbal Masjid
religious_places.description: A significant Muslim shrine housing the Moi-e-Muqqadas, believed to be a hair of Prophet Muhammad. Its white marble structure overlooks Dal Lake.

religious_places.name: Raghunath Mandir
religious_places.description: The largest temple complex in Northern India, dedicated to Lord Rama, built by Maharaja Ranbir Singh in 1857, featuring seven shrines and gold-plated interiors.

religious_places.name: Shankaracharya Temple
religious_places.description: A 4th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located on Shankaracharya Hill, offering spiritual significance and panoramic views of Srinagar.

religious_places.name: Kheer Bhawani Temple
religious_places.description: A revered Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Bhawani, known for its holy spring and offerings of kheer by Kashmiri Pandits, especially during festivals.

religious_places.name: Jamia Masjid
religious_places.description: Built in 1400 AD, this mosque in Nowhatta features Indo-Saracen architecture with 370 wooden pillars and a large courtyard, attracting thousands for Friday prayers.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Chhevin Patshahi
religious_places.description: A historic Sikh gurdwara near Dal Lake, dedicated to Guru Hargobind, visited by Guru Nanak Dev, known for its serene setting and spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Martand Sun Temple
religious_places.description: An 8th-century Hindu temple dedicated to the Sun God, built by Lalitaditya Muktapida, showcasing Kashmiri architecture despite being in ruins.

religious_places.name: Charar-e-Sharief
religious_places.description: A 600-year-old Sufi shrine dedicated to Sheikh Noor-ud-Din Noorani, known for its Kashmiri wooden architecture and lush gardens.

religious_places.name: Peer Kho Cave Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu cave temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, linked to Jamvant from the Ramayana, located along the Tawi River, popular during Shivratri.

religious_places.name: Lamayuru Monastery
religious_places.description: An 11th-century Buddhist monastery in Ladakh, known as 'Moonland' for its unique landscape, housing religious artifacts and offering scenic views.

religious_places.name: Ranbireshwar Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, built by Raja Ranbir Singh, featuring a 7.5-foot crystal lingam and gold-clad walls.

religious_places.name: Holy Family Catholic Church
religious_places.description: One of Srinagar’s oldest churches, established in 1896, known for its serene ambiance and historical significance for the Christian community.

religious_places.name: Dastgeer Sahib
religious_places.description: A 200-year-old Sufi shrine dedicated to Sheikh Abdul Qadir Jeelani, known for its holy relics and Kashmiri architecture, rebuilt after a 2013 fire.

religious_places.name: Badrinath Temple
religious_places.description: One of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites, this Hindu temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu, located along the Alaknanda River in the Garhwal Himalayas.

religious_places.name: Kedarnath Temple
religious_places.description: A sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, part of the Char Dham and one of the twelve Jyotirlingas, situated at 3,583 meters in the Himalayas.

religious_places.name: Gangotri Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Ganga, part of the Char Dham, located near the source of the Ganges River in the Uttarkashi district.

religious_places.name: Yamunotri Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Yamuna, part of the Char Dham, situated near the source of the Yamuna River in the Garhwal Himalayas.

religious_places.name: Hemkund Sahib
religious_places.description: A sacred Sikh gurdwara dedicated to Guru Gobind Singh, located at 4,632 meters near a glacial lake, surrounded by seven snow-capped peaks.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Dehradun
religious_places.description: A prominent mosque in the heart of Dehradun, known for its serene ambiance and serving as a key place of worship for the Muslim community.

religious_places.name: Neelkanth Mahadev Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located amidst lush forests near Rishikesh, associated with the legend of Shiva consuming poison during Samudra Manthan.

religious_places.name: Tungnath Temple
religious_places.description: The highest Shiva temple in the world at 3,680 meters, part of the Panch Kedar pilgrimage circuit, known for its ancient architecture and scenic beauty.

religious_places.name: Mindrolling Monastery
religious_places.description: One of the largest Buddhist monasteries in India, belonging to the Nyingma school, featuring a 60-meter stupa and vibrant Tibetan architecture.

religious_places.name: Jwalamukhi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Jwalamukhi, revered as a Shakti Peeth, known for its spiritual significance and serene hilltop location.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Nanakmatta Sahib
religious_places.description: A historic Sikh gurdwara associated with Guru Nanak Dev, located in Udham Singh Nagar, known for its peaceful setting and religious importance.

religious_places.name: St. Francis Church
religious_places.description: A historic Christian church in Dehradun, known for its colonial architecture and serene environment, serving the local Christian community.

religious_places.name: Kartik Swami Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Kartikeya, located at 3,050 meters, offering panoramic Himalayan views and a serene spiritual atmosphere.

religious_places.name: Piran Kaliyar Sharif
religious_places.description: A Sufi shrine dedicated to Hazrat Alauddin Ali Ahmed Sabir, a 13th-century saint, attracting devotees of all faiths for its spiritual ambiance.

religious_places.name: Laxman Jhula Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple near the Laxman Jhula bridge, dedicated to Lord Rama and Laxman, revered for its association with the Ramayana and scenic riverside location.

religious_places.name: Tirumala Venkateswara Temple
religious_places.description: One of the holiest Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, a form of Vishnu, located on the Tirumala Hills, attracting millions of pilgrims annually.

religious_places.name: Sri Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Narasimha, an incarnation of Vishnu, known for its unique architecture and serene hilltop location near Visakhapatnam.

religious_places.name: Kanaka Durga Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Durga, situated on Indrakeeladri Hill, revered during the Navratri festival for its spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple
religious_places.description: A historic Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, known for its Dravidian architecture and religious importance in the region.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Guntur
religious_places.description: A significant mosque in Guntur, known for its simple yet elegant architecture, serving as a central place of worship for the Muslim community.

religious_places.name: St. Mary’s Church
religious_places.description: A historic Christian church known for its serene ambiance and colonial architecture, serving the local Christian community in Visakhapatnam.

religious_places.name: Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji Gurudwara
religious_places.description: A Sikh gurdwara dedicated to Guru Nanak Dev, offering a peaceful environment for worship and community service, located in the heart of Vijayawada.

religious_places.name: Srikalahasti Temple
religious_places.description: A revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known as one of the Pancha Bhoota Stalam, representing the element of air, famous for Rahu-Ketu poojas.

religious_places.name: Annavaram Satyanarayana Swamy Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Satyanarayana, known for its scenic location and the performance of Satyanarayana Vratam by devotees.

religious_places.name: Bhadrachalam Sri Rama Temple
religious_places.description: A significant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Rama, located on the banks of the Godavari River, associated with the Ramayana and vibrant during Sri Rama Navami.

religious_places.name: Jain Temple, Kolanupaka
religious_places.description: An ancient Jain temple housing a 1.5-meter statue of Lord Mahavira, known for its historical significance and intricate carvings.

religious_places.name: Masjid-e-Mohammadi
religious_places.description: A prominent mosque in Visakhapatnam, serving as a key worship site for the Muslim community, known for its peaceful ambiance.

religious_places.name: Sri Raghavendra Swamy Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Guru Raghavendra Swamy, a revered saint, located on the banks of the Tungabhadra River, attracting devotees for spiritual solace.

religious_places.name: St. Paul’s Church
religious_places.description: A historic Christian church in Vijayawada, known for its Gothic-style architecture and serene environment, serving the local Christian community.

religious_places.name: Draksharamam Bhimeswara Swamy Temple
religious_places.description: One of the Pancharama Kshetras, this Hindu temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its ancient architecture and spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Tawang Monastery
religious_places.description: The largest Buddhist monastery in India, built in the 17th century, dedicated to Mahayana Buddhism. It houses a 28-foot golden Buddha statue and ancient scriptures, offering serene views of the Tawang-Chu valley.

religious_places.name: Parshuram Kund
religious_places.description: A Hindu pilgrimage site on the Lohit River, where sage Parshuram is believed to have washed away his sins. It attracts devotees for a holy dip, especially during Makar Sankranti.

religious_places.name: Malinithan Temple
religious_places.description: An archaeological Hindu temple site from the 13th-14th century, dedicated to Goddess Durga, believed to be a Shakti Peeth where a part of Sati’s body fell.

religious_places.name: Akashiganga Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple near a sacred pond, regarded as a Shakti Peeth where Sati’s head is believed to have fallen, revered for its spiritual significance and Odisha-style architecture.

religious_places.name: Bomdila Monastery
religious_places.description: A major Mahayana Buddhist monastery, also known as Gentse Gaden Rabgyel Lling, built in 1965, featuring a large prayer hall and quarters for monks.

religious_places.name: Golden Pagoda (Kongmu Kham)
religious_places.description: A Buddhist monastery with Burmese-style architecture, opened in 2010, dedicated to Lord Buddha, known for its serene ambiance and vibrant festivals like Kathina Civara Dana.

religious_places.name: Donyi Polo Temple
religious_places.description: A significant place of worship for the Donyi-Polo faith, dedicated to the Sun and Moon, reflecting the indigenous beliefs of the Adi and other Tani tribes.

religious_places.name: Urgelling Monastery
religious_places.description: A historic Buddhist monastery, the birthplace of the sixth Dalai Lama, built in 1489, surrounded by the Himalayas and Tawang-Chu valley.

religious_places.name: Meghna Cave Temple
religious_places.description: A 5000-year-old Hindu cave temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, discovered with a naturally formed Shiv Lingam, located near Hapoli township.

religious_places.name: Gorsam Chorten Stupa
religious_places.description: A large Buddhist stupa built in the 7th century by Merag Lama, known for its historical significance and serene setting near the Tawang district.

religious_places.name: Chilipam Monastery
religious_places.description: A Mahayana Buddhist monastery atop a hill near Bomdila, known for its scenic beauty and spiritual ambiance, attracting monks and visitors.

religious_places.name: Sidheshwar Nath Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple in Ziro Valley, dedicated to Lord Shiva, revered for its spiritual significance and association with local tribal beliefs.

religious_places.name: Theravada Buddhist Temple
religious_places.description: A serene Buddhist temple in the capital city, dedicated to Theravada Buddhism, offering a peaceful retreat and a place for meditation.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Neh Pema Shelphu
religious_places.description: A Sikh gurdwara in the scenic Mechuka valley, serving as a spiritual center for the local Sikh community and visitors seeking peace.

religious_places.name: Itanagar Baptist Church
religious_places.description: A prominent Christian church in the capital, serving the Christian community, which forms a significant portion of Arunachal Pradesh’s population.

religious_places.name: Kamakhya Temple
religious_places.description: A major Hindu Shakti Peeth dedicated to Goddess Kamakhya, located on Nilachal Hill, known for its tantric worship and the annual Ambubachi Mela.

religious_places.name: Umananda Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, situated on Peacock Island in the Brahmaputra River, accessible by ferry, known for its scenic beauty.

religious_places.name: Hajo Powa Mecca
religious_places.description: A historic mosque believed to have a quarter of the sanctity of Mecca, attracting Muslim pilgrims and revered for its spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Sahib
religious_places.description: A historic Sikh gurdwara built to commemorate Guru Tegh Bahadur’s visit, one of the oldest gurdwaras in Assam, located on the Brahmaputra’s banks.

religious_places.name: Christ Church
religious_places.description: One of the oldest churches in Northeast India, established in 1844, known for its colonial architecture and serene environment for Christian worship.

religious_places.name: Hayagriva Madhava Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, also revered by Buddhists, known for its ancient architecture and multi-religious significance.

religious_places.name: Navagraha Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to the nine planetary deities, located on Chitrachal Hill, known for its astrological significance and panoramic views.

religious_places.name: Basistha Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, founded by sage Basistha, located amidst lush greenery near a stream, popular for its serene setting.

religious_places.name: Sukreswar Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located on the Brahmaputra River’s banks, known for housing one of the largest Shiva lingams in India.

religious_places.name: Dirgheshwari Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Durga, considered a Shakti Peeth, located on the northern bank of the Brahmaputra, revered for tantric worship.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Nagaon
religious_places.description: A prominent mosque serving the Muslim community in Nagaon, known for its serene ambiance and role as a center for religious gatherings.

religious_places.name: Srimanta Sankardev Namghar
religious_places.description: A Vaishnavite prayer hall in the Satra tradition, founded by Srimanta Sankardev, central to Assamese culture and spirituality on Majuli island.

religious_places.name: Shiva Dol
religious_places.description: A historic Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, built by the Ahom queen Ambika in 1734, part of a complex with Vishnu and Devi temples.

religious_places.name: Tilinga Mandir
religious_places.description: A unique Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for thousands of bells tied by devotees as offerings for wish fulfillment.

religious_places.name: Jorhat Baptist Church
religious_places.description: A prominent Christian church in Jorhat, serving the local Christian community with its serene environment and historical significance.

religious_places.name: Mahabodhi Temple
religious_places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site where Gautama Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree. It is a major Buddhist pilgrimage destination with global significance.

religious_places.name: Patna Sahib (Takht Sri Harmandir Ji)
religious_places.description: One of the five Takhts in Sikhism, this gurdwara marks the birthplace of Guru Gobind Singh, known for its historical and spiritual importance.

religious_places.name: Vishnupad Temple
religious_places.description: A historic Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, famous for its 40 cm footprint believed to be Vishnu’s, a key site for pind daan rituals.

religious_places.name: Mahavir Mandir
religious_places.description: One of the most visited Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Hanuman, attracting millions, especially during festivals like Ram Navami.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Gaya
religious_places.description: A prominent mosque in Gaya, serving as a central place of worship for the Muslim community, known for its serene ambiance and historical significance.

religious_places.name: Mundeshwari Temple
religious_places.description: One of the oldest functional Hindu temples, dedicated to Goddess Mundeshwari, dating back to the 7th century, known for its unique octagonal structure.

religious_places.name: Thai Monastery
religious_places.description: A Buddhist monastery built in Thai architectural style, offering a serene space for meditation and attracting international pilgrims.

religious_places.name: Patan Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A revered Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Durga, one of the 51 Shakti Peethas, known for its spiritual significance and vibrant festivals.

religious_places.name: Jain Mahavir Temple
religious_places.description: A sacred Jain temple marking the cremation site of Lord Mahavira, surrounded by a lotus-filled tank, a major pilgrimage site for Jains.

religious_places.name: St. Luke’s Church
religious_places.description: A historic Christian church serving the local community, known for its simple architecture and serene environment for worship.

religious_places.name: Vishwa Shanti Stupa
religious_places.description: A Buddhist peace pagoda built by the Japanese Nipponzan Myohoji, located on Ratnagiri Hill, symbolizing peace and unity.

religious_places.name: Barabar Caves
religious_places.description: Ancient rock-cut caves from the Mauryan era, primarily associated with Ajivika and Buddhist monks, known for their polished granite interiors.

religious_places.name: Bari Patan Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A historic Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Durga, revered as a Shakti Peeth, attracting devotees for its spiritual and cultural significance.

religious_places.name: Hariharnath Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Lord Shiva, famous for the Sonepur Mela, a major religious and cultural festival.

religious_places.name: Kundalpur Jain Temple
religious_places.description: A significant Jain temple associated with Lord Mahavira’s birthplace, featuring serene architecture and a key pilgrimage site for Jains.

religious_places.name: Danteshwari Temple
religious_places.description: A revered Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Danteshwari, a form of Goddess Durga, considered the patron deity of the Bastar region, attracting devotees during the Bastar Dussehra festival.

religious_places.name: Bamleshwari Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Bamleshwari, located atop a hill, accessible by ropeway or steps, known for its spiritual significance and scenic views.

religious_places.name: Mahamaya Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Mahamaya, a form of Durga, known for its historical significance and vibrant Navratri celebrations.

religious_places.name: Chandrahasini Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Chandrahasini, located on the banks of the Mahanadi River, revered for its serene setting and annual fairs.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Raipur
religious_places.description: A significant mosque in the state capital, known for its peaceful ambiance and architectural simplicity, serving as a central place of worship for Muslims.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Guru Singh Sabha
religious_places.description: A prominent Sikh gurdwara in Raipur, offering a serene environment for worship and community service, known for its langar and religious gatherings.

religious_places.name: Shiv Mandir Bhoramdeo
religious_places.description: An 11th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, often called the 'Khajuraho of Chhattisgarh' for its intricate carvings and historical significance.

religious_places.name: St. Paul’s Cathedral
religious_places.description: A prominent Christian church in Raipur, known for its serene ambiance and colonial-style architecture, serving the local Christian community.

religious_places.name: Maa Kudargarhi Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kudargarhi, located in a scenic hilly area, popular among locals for its spiritual significance and natural beauty.

religious_places.name: Shri Rajiv Lochan Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, known for its 8th-century architecture and intricate carvings, attracting devotees and tourists.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Shri Guru Teg Bahadur Sahib
religious_places.description: A Sikh gurdwara in Bhilai, dedicated to Guru Teg Bahadur, known for its community services and spiritual gatherings, attracting devotees from the region.

religious_places.name: Maa Purni Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Purni, revered by locals for its spiritual significance and vibrant festivals like Navratri.

religious_places.name: Jain Temple Ratanpur
religious_places.description: A Jain temple known for its serene environment and intricate architecture, attracting Jain devotees and visitors interested in religious heritage.

religious_places.name: Maa Bilasa Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Bilasa, a form of Durga, known for its historical importance and vibrant local festivals.

religious_places.name: Kankali Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kankali, revered by tribal communities in Bastar, known for its unique rituals and cultural significance.

religious_places.name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
religious_places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this Catholic church houses the remains of St. Francis Xavier. It is renowned for its Baroque architecture and historical significance.

religious_places.name: Se Cathedral
religious_places.description: One of the largest churches in Asia, dedicated to St. Catherine, known for its Portuguese-Manueline architecture and the Golden Bell.

religious_places.name: Shri Mangueshi Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its seven-story lamp tower and traditional Goan architecture.

religious_places.name: Shri Shantadurga Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Shantadurga, revered for promoting peace, featuring a striking idol and traditional Goan design.

religious_places.name: Safa Shahouri Masjid
religious_places.description: One of the oldest mosques in Goa, built in 1560 by Ibrahim Adil Shah, known for its simple architecture and historical significance.

religious_places.name: Church of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception
religious_places.description: A prominent Catholic church in Panaji, known for its white facade, Baroque architecture, and iconic double staircase.

religious_places.name: Mahalaxmi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Mahalaxmi, the first temple built in Panaji after Portuguese rule, known for its serene ambiance.

religious_places.name: Shri Mahadev Temple
religious_places.description: A 12th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, the only surviving Kadamba-Yadava structure, known for its intricate stone carvings.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Shri Guru Singh Sabha
religious_places.description: A Sikh gurdwara serving the local Sikh community, known for its peaceful environment and community services like langar.

religious_places.name: St. Augustine’s Church
religious_places.description: A partially ruined Catholic church, once part of a large Augustinian complex, known for its historical significance and 46-meter tower remains.

religious_places.name: Shri Naguesh Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its ancient origins and traditional Goan architecture, located in a serene setting.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Margao
religious_places.description: A key mosque in South Goa, serving the Muslim community's religious needs, known for its simple yet functional architecture.

religious_places.name: Shri Kamakshi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kamakshi, known for its peaceful ambiance and annual festivals attracting devotees.

religious_places.name: Church of St. Cajetan
religious_places.description: A 17th-century Catholic church modeled after St. Peter’s Basilica, known for its Corinthian architecture and historical significance.

religious_places.name: Shri Ramnath Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Rama, known for its intricate carvings and association with the Ramanavami festival.

religious_places.name: Somnath Temple
religious_places.description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, this ancient Hindu temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva, located on the Arabian Sea coast, revered for its spiritual and historical significance.

religious_places.name: Dwarkadhish Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Krishna, part of the Char Dham pilgrimage, known for its stunning architecture and location near the Gomti River.

religious_places.name: Palitana Jain Temples
religious_places.description: A sacred Jain pilgrimage site with over 800 marble temples on Shatrunjaya Hill, dedicated to Tirthankaras, known for their intricate carvings.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid
religious_places.description: A 15th-century mosque built by Sultan Ahmed Shah, featuring intricate sandstone carvings and a large courtyard, serving as a major Islamic worship site.

religious_places.name: Iranshah Atash Behram
religious_places.description: A sacred Zoroastrian fire temple, housing a consecrated fire burning for centuries, revered by the Parsi community for its spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Akshardham Temple
religious_places.description: A grand Hindu temple complex dedicated to Swaminarayan, known for its intricate carvings, lush gardens, and cultural exhibits.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Guru Nanak Khalsa
religious_places.description: A prominent Sikh gurdwara in Surat, known for its serene environment and community services, attracting devotees for prayers and langar.

religious_places.name: Modhera Sun Temple
religious_places.description: An 11th-century Hindu temple dedicated to the Sun God, built by the Solanki dynasty, renowned for its intricate stone carvings and stepwell.

religious_places.name: St. Xavier’s Church
religious_places.description: A historic Christian church known for its Gothic architecture and serene ambiance, serving the local Christian community in Ahmedabad.

religious_places.name: Ambaji Temple
religious_places.description: A major Shakti Peeth dedicated to Goddess Amba, attracting millions of Hindu devotees, especially during Navratri, for its spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Sidi Saiyyed Mosque
religious_places.description: A 16th-century mosque famous for its intricate stone latticework, especially the 'Tree of Life' jali, a significant Islamic architectural site.

religious_places.name: Shamlaji Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, known for its intricate carvings and serene setting along the Meshwo River.

religious_places.name: Girnar Jain Temples
religious_places.description: A group of Jain temples on Mount Girnar, dedicated to Tirthankaras like Neminath, known for their scenic climb and spiritual importance.

religious_places.name: Bhujiyo Kotho Jain Temple
religious_places.description: A significant Jain temple in Kutch, dedicated to Tirthankara Mahavira, known for its serene ambiance and regional importance.

religious_places.name: Nagarpalika Church
religious_places.description: A historic Christian church in Vadodara, known for its colonial architecture and role as a place of worship for the local Christian community.

religious_places.name: Mata Mansa Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Mansa Devi, part of the Shakta tradition, attracting thousands during Navratri for blessings and wish fulfillment.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Bangla Sahib
religious_places.description: A historic Sikh gurdwara associated with Guru Harkrishan, known for its serene ambiance and sacred pool, drawing devotees for its spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Brahma Sarovar
religious_places.description: A sacred Hindu site with temples around a holy lake, linked to Lord Brahma’s creation myth, popular for rituals and the Gita Mahotsav festival.

religious_places.name: Nada Sahib Gurudwara
religious_places.description: A revered Sikh gurdwara commemorating Guru Gobind Singh’s visit, known for its peaceful riverside setting and vibrant religious gatherings.

religious_places.name: Sheetla Mata Mandir
religious_places.description: A popular Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Sheetla, believed to cure diseases, attracting devotees especially during the Sheetla Ashtami festival.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Faridabad
religious_places.description: A significant mosque serving the Muslim community in Faridabad, known for its simple yet elegant architecture and role as a community worship center.

religious_places.name: Bhuteshwar Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, associated with the Mahabharata, known for its spiritual ambiance and historical significance.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Manji Sahib
religious_places.description: A historic Sikh gurdwara linked to Guru Tegh Bahadur, known for its serene environment and role in Sikh religious and cultural activities.

religious_places.name: St. Mary’s Orthodox Church
religious_places.description: A prominent Christian church serving the Orthodox community, known for its peaceful ambiance and role in local religious services.

religious_places.name: Sannihit Sarovar
religious_places.description: A sacred Hindu site with a holy tank and surrounding temples, believed to be the meeting point of seven sacred rivers, popular for rituals and solar eclipse ceremonies.

religious_places.name: Pataudi Palace Mosque
religious_places.description: A historic mosque within the Pataudi Palace complex, reflecting Mughal architecture, serving as a local worship site for the Muslim community.

religious_places.name: Jyotisar
religious_places.description: A sacred Hindu site believed to be where Lord Krishna delivered the Bhagavad Gita to Arjuna, featuring a banyan tree and temple complex.

religious_places.name: Baba Farid Dargah
religious_places.description: A Sufi shrine dedicated to Baba Farid, a 12th-century saint, attracting devotees of all faiths for its spiritual ambiance and historical significance.

religious_places.name: Chintpurni Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Chintpurni, revered as a Shakti Peeth, known for granting devotees relief from worries and fulfilling wishes.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Kapal Mochan
religious_places.description: A historic Sikh gurdwara associated with Guru Gobind Singh, known for its sacred pool and spiritual significance, especially during annual fairs.

religious_places.name: Hidimba Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A 15th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Hidimba, built in a cave with a wooden pagoda-style structure, surrounded by cedar forests.

religious_places.name: Baijnath Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, built in the 13th century, known for its Nagara-style architecture and spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Key Monastery
religious_places.description: A 11th-century Tibetan Buddhist monastery perched at 4,166 meters, known for its ancient murals, manuscripts, and stunning Himalayan views.

religious_places.name: Jwalamukhi Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A revered Hindu temple, one of the 51 Shakti Peethas, where an eternal flame burns, dedicated to Goddess Jwalamukhi.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Paonta Sahib
religious_places.description: A historic Sikh gurdwara built in honor of Guru Gobind Singh, located on the banks of the Yamuna River, known for its serene ambiance.

religious_places.name: Chamunda Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Chamunda, located on the banks of the Baner River, revered as a Shakti Peeth with scenic surroundings.

religious_places.name: Tabo Monastery
religious_places.description: A 10th-century Buddhist monastery, one of the oldest in the Himalayas, known for its ancient frescoes, thangkas, and mud-brick architecture.

religious_places.name: Bhagsunath Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located near Bhagsu Falls, popular among locals and tourists for its spiritual and scenic appeal.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Dharamshala
religious_places.description: A historic mosque in the heart of Dharamshala, serving as a key place of worship for the Muslim community with a serene environment.

religious_places.name: Naina Devi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Naina Devi, one of the Shakti Peethas, located on a hilltop overlooking Gobind Sagar Lake.

religious_places.name: Christ Church Shimla
religious_places.description: A historic Anglican church built in 1857, known for its neo-Gothic architecture and stained glass, located on the Ridge in Shimla.

religious_places.name: Jakhoo Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman, located on Jakhoo Hill, featuring a 108-foot statue of Hanuman and panoramic views of Shimla.

religious_places.name: Dhankar Monastery
religious_places.description: A Buddhist monastery at 3,894 meters, perched on a cliff, known for its ancient artifacts and breathtaking views of the Spiti River.

religious_places.name: Chintpurni Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Chintpurni, one of the Shakti Peethas, attracting devotees seeking blessings for wish fulfillment.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Shri Manikaran Sahib
religious_places.description: A sacred Sikh gurdwara associated with Guru Nanak, located near hot springs, known for its spiritual significance and free langar service.

religious_places.name: Jagannath Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Jagannath, modeled after the Puri Jagannath Temple, known for its annual Rath Yatra and hilltop location.

religious_places.name: Deoghar Baidyanath Temple
religious_places.description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, this Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva attracts millions during Shravan, known for its spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Ranchi
religious_places.description: A historic mosque in the heart of Ranchi, serving as a major worship site for the Muslim community with its serene ambiance and traditional architecture.

religious_places.name: St. Mary’s Cathedral
religious_places.description: A prominent Catholic church, serving as the seat of the Archdiocese of Ranchi, known for its Gothic-style architecture and peaceful environment.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Singh Sabha
religious_places.description: A significant Sikh gurdwara in Jamshedpur, known for its community service and spiritual importance, attracting devotees for prayers and langar.

religious_places.name: Basukinath Temple
religious_places.description: A revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, part of the Deoghar pilgrimage circuit, known for its spiritual significance during Shravan.

religious_places.name: Chhinnamasta Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Chhinnamasta, one of the ten Mahavidyas, located at the confluence of Bhairavi and Damodar rivers, popular among Tantric devotees.

religious_places.name: Sarna Sthal
religious_places.description: A sacred grove for the Sarna religion of tribal communities, where worshippers revere nature and ancestral spirits under sal trees, reflecting indigenous traditions.

religious_places.name: Angrabadi Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple complex dedicated to Lord Rama, Shiva, and Hanuman, known for its serene environment and local spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Pahari Mandir
religious_places.description: A hilltop Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, offering panoramic views of Ranchi and a popular pilgrimage spot during festivals like Shivratri.

religious_places.name: Naulakha Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Radha-Krishna, built by Queen Charushila, known for its architectural beauty and proximity to Baidyanath Temple.

religious_places.name: Lutheran Church
religious_places.description: A historic Protestant church in Ranchi, serving the Christian community with its simple architecture and serene atmosphere.

religious_places.name: Maluti Temples
religious_places.description: A cluster of 72 terracotta Hindu temples dedicated to various deities, built by the Baj Basanta dynasty, showcasing unique architecture.

religious_places.name: Jain Swetambar Temple
religious_places.description: A Jain temple dedicated to Tirthankara Mahavira, known for its peaceful ambiance and intricate design, serving the local Jain community.

religious_places.name: Bindudham Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple complex dedicated to Lord Hanuman and other deities, located on Binduwasini Hill, popular for its spiritual and scenic appeal.

religious_places.name: Sri Venkateswara Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, known for its Dravidian architecture and spiritual ambiance, attracting devotees in Bengaluru.

religious_places.name: Udupi Sri Krishna Matha
religious_places.description: A historic Hindu temple founded by Madhvacharya, dedicated to Lord Krishna, famous for its unique worship style and the Kanakana Kindi window.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid
religious_places.description: One of Bengaluru’s oldest mosques, built in the 18th century, known for its serene ambiance and Mughal-style architecture, serving the Muslim community.

religious_places.name: Shravanabelagola
religious_places.description: A major Jain pilgrimage site featuring the 17.7-meter monolithic statue of Lord Bahubali, a UNESCO tentative site, revered for its historical significance.

religious_places.name: St. Mary’s Basilica
religious_places.description: The oldest church in Bengaluru, established in 1818, known for its Gothic architecture and the annual St. Mary’s Feast, a key Christian site.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Nanak Jhira Sahib
religious_places.description: A historic Sikh gurdwara associated with Guru Nanak, known for its holy spring and sprawling complex, attracting devotees across India.

religious_places.name: Dharmasthala Manjunatha Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, managed by the Jain Heggade family, known for its inclusive ethos and charitable activities.

religious_places.name: Murudeshwar Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, famous for its 123-foot statue of Shiva and a 20-story gopuram, located along the Arabian Sea coast.

religious_places.name: Gomateshwara Temple
religious_places.description: A Jain temple featuring a 13-meter statue of Lord Bahubali, established in 1432, known for its historical and architectural significance.

religious_places.name: Sri Chamundeshwari Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple atop Chamundi Hills, dedicated to Goddess Chamundeshwari, the deity of the Mysore royal family, attracting devotees during Navratri.

religious_places.name: Hazrat Shah Khadri Dargah
religious_places.description: A revered Sufi shrine dedicated to Hazrat Shah Khadri, known for its spiritual ambiance and attracting devotees of all faiths.

religious_places.name: Sri Mookambika Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Mookambika, located in the Western Ghats, revered for its spiritual significance and association with Adi Shankaracharya.

religious_places.name: St. Philomena’s Cathedral
religious_places.description: A neo-Gothic Catholic cathedral built in 1936, known for its stunning architecture and one of the tallest churches in Asia, serving the Christian community.

religious_places.name: Kukke Subrahmaniya Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Kartikeya, nestled in the Western Ghats, famous for rituals like Sarpa Samskara to alleviate astrological afflictions.

religious_places.name: Moodabidri Jain Temples
religious_places.description: A group of 18 Jain temples, known as the 'Jain Kashi,' famous for their intricate stone carvings and historical significance in Jainism.

religious_places.name: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple
religious_places.description: A historic Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, known for its architectural grandeur and the famed treasure vaults, a major pilgrimage site.

religious_places.name: Guruvayur Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Krishna, known as the 'Dwarka of the South,' famous for its festivals and elephant processions.

religious_places.name: Cheraman Juma Masjid
religious_places.description: Believed to be India’s first mosque, built in 629 AD, showcasing traditional Kerala architecture and symbolizing religious harmony.

religious_places.name: St. Francis Church
religious_places.description: Built in 1503, one of India’s oldest European churches, associated with Vasco da Gama’s burial, known for its historical and architectural significance.

religious_places.name: Paradesi Synagogue
religious_places.description: Built in 1568, one of the oldest active synagogues in India, renowned for its Belgian chandeliers and hand-painted floor tiles in Jew Town.

religious_places.name: Sabarimala Sree Dharma Sastha Temple
religious_places.description: A major Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Ayyappa, attracting millions during the Mandala season, located in the Western Ghats.

religious_places.name: Malik Dinar Mosque
religious_places.description: One of Kerala’s oldest mosques, established by Malik Dinar, known for its historical significance and traditional Kerala-style architecture.

religious_places.name: Santa Cruz Basilica
religious_places.description: A historic Catholic church built by the Portuguese in 1558, known for its Gothic architecture and vibrant interiors, a key Christian pilgrimage site.

religious_places.name: Thrissur Vadakkumnathan Temple
religious_places.description: An Burnham*An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, famous for hosting the Thrissur Pooram festival, known for its classic Kerala architecture.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Shri Guru Nanak Ji
religious_places.description: A Sikh gurdwara in Mattancherry, serving the local Sikh community, known for its serene ambiance and religious significance.

religious_places.name: Jain Temple, Palakkad
religious_places.description: A Digambara Jain temple dedicated to Lord Mahavira, known for its peaceful environment and intricate carvings, attracting Jain devotees.

religious_places.name: Attukal Bhagavathy Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kannaki, famous for the Attukal Pongala festival, one of the largest gatherings of women devotees.

religious_places.name: Pazhassi Raja Jama Masjid
religious_places.description: A historic mosque known for its traditional architecture and cultural significance, serving as a key worship site for Muslims in North Kerala.

religious_places.name: Annapoorneshwari Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Annapurna, known for its serene ambiance and traditional Kerala-style architecture.

religious_places.name: St. Thomas Syro-Malabar Church
religious_places.description: One of the seven churches founded by St. Thomas in 52 AD, a significant pilgrimage site for Syrian Christians, known for its historical legacy.

religious_places.name: Shri Siddhivinayak Temple
religious_places.description: A renowned Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha, one of Mumbai's most visited religious sites, known for its spiritual significance and ornate architecture.

religious_places.name: Shirdi Sai Baba Temple
religious_places.description: A major pilgrimage site dedicated to Sai Baba, attracting devotees worldwide for its spiritual ambiance and charitable activities.

religious_places.name: Haji Ali Dargah
religious_places.description: A historic Islamic shrine dedicated to Pir Haji Ali Shah Bukhari, located on an islet off the coast, accessible by a causeway, revered by all faiths.

religious_places.name: Mahalaxmi Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Mahalaxmi, situated near the sea, known for its vibrant festivals and spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Takht Hazur Sahib
religious_places.description: One of the five Takhts in Sikhism, associated with Guru Gobind Singh, known for its grand architecture and historical importance.

religious_places.name: Mount Mary Basilica
religious_places.description: A historic Roman Catholic church dedicated to Virgin Mary, famous for the annual Bandra Fair and its scenic hilltop location.

religious_places.name: Ellora Caves
religious_places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site with rock-cut Hindu, Buddhist, and Jain temples, including the Kailasa Temple, showcasing ancient Indian architecture.

religious_places.name: Ajanta Caves
religious_places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring Buddhist cave temples with intricate paintings and sculptures, dating back to the 2nd century BCE.

religious_places.name: Trimbakeshwar Temple
religious_places.description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, this Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva is located near Nashik, known for its unique three-faced lingam.

religious_places.name: Bhimashankar Temple
religious_places.description: A Jyotirlinga temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, nestled in the Sahyadri Hills, known for its serene environment and biodiversity hotspot.

religious_places.name: Jain Temple, Kolhapur
religious_places.description: A significant Jain temple dedicated to Lord Mahavira, known for its intricate carvings and spiritual importance for the Jain community.

religious_places.name: Global Vipassana Pagoda
religious_places.description: A Buddhist meditation center and monument, built to promote Vipassana meditation, featuring a large golden pagoda and serene surroundings.

religious_places.name: Mumbadevi Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Mumbadevi, the patron deity of Mumbai, located in the bustling Bhuleshwar area.

religious_places.name: St. Thomas Cathedral
religious_places.description: One of India’s oldest churches, built in 1718, known for its colonial Gothic architecture and historical significance for the Christian community.

religious_places.name: Pandharpur Vitthal Temple
religious_places.description: A major Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Vitthal (Vishnu), central to the Varkari tradition, attracting millions during Ashadhi Ekadashi.

religious_places.name: Shree Govindajee Temple
religious_places.description: A historic Vaishnavite Hindu temple built in 1846 by Manipuri royals, dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha, featuring gold-plated domes and Nagara-style architecture.

religious_places.name: Sanamahi Temple
religious_places.description: A key Sanamahist shrine at First Manipur Rifles Ground, dedicated to Lainingthou Sanamahi, the household deity of the Meitei people, central to indigenous religious practices.

religious_places.name: ISKCON Imphal, Sri Sri Radha Krishnacandra Temple
religious_places.description: A prominent Hindu temple combining Manipuri and Indian architectural styles, dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha, attracting devotees globally, especially during Janmashtami.

religious_places.name: Mahabali Temple
religious_places.description: A historic Hindu temple built in 1725 by Maharaja Garib Niwaj, dedicated to Lord Hanuman in a unique dancing posture, revered by the Ramanadi cult.

religious_places.name: Hiyangthang Lairembi Temple
religious_places.description: A significant Meitei temple on a hillock, dedicated to Goddess Hiyangthang Lairembi, popular during the Bor festival, offering scenic views of Imphal.

religious_places.name: Babupara Mosque
religious_places.description: A central place of worship for the Muslim community in Imphal, especially significant during Eid, located near the city junction.

religious_places.name: St. Joseph’s Cathedral
religious_places.description: A prominent Catholic cathedral with Anglo-Manipuri architecture, serving as a key pilgrimage center for Christians in Imphal.

religious_places.name: Imphal Central Church
religious_places.description: A significant Christian church on Airport Road, known as the Imphal School of Preaching, hosting regular Bible classes and prayers.

religious_places.name: Christian Center Church
religious_places.description: A Christian church in the main bazaar, featuring a large Jesus statue, with hostels and missionary schools, linked to its head church in Toronto.

religious_places.name: Senapati Catholic Church
religious_places.description: A local Catholic shrine in Senapati district, hosting daily and weekly prayers, a key religious and tourist spot for the Christian community.

religious_places.name: Tamenglong Baptist Church
religious_places.description: A sacred Baptist church in Tamenglong, popular among locals and tourists, known for regular prayers and religious events.

religious_places.name: Vishnu Temple
religious_places.description: A 15th-century Hindu temple built by Maharaja Kiyamba, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, known for its Chinese-influenced architecture.

religious_places.name: Sridhara Temple
religious_places.description: A serene Hindu temple in Bishnupur, surrounded by greenery, with carvings depicting Ramayana and Mahabharata, open 24 hours.

religious_places.name: Kaina Shri Govindajee Temple
religious_places.description: A sacred Hindu temple on a hillock, built from a jackfruit tree as per Maharaja Bhagyachandra’s vision, famous for Raas Leela celebrations.

religious_places.name: Leimapokpam Keirungba Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to local deities, reflecting Meitei traditions, attracting devotees for its cultural and spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Nartiang Durga Temple
religious_places.description: A 500-year-old Hindu temple, one of the 51 Shakti Peethas, believed to be where the left thigh of Goddess Sati fell, revered for its unique Khasi-Hindu rituals.

religious_places.name: Cathedral of Mary Help of Christians
religious_places.description: A major Catholic cathedral in Shillong, known for its high arches, stained glass windows, and serene hilltop setting, serving over 300,000 Catholics.

religious_places.name: Mawjymbuin Cave Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu cave temple with a naturally formed Shivalinga, revered by locals, especially during Shivratri, set in the wettest place on Earth.

religious_places.name: Madina Masjid
religious_places.description: The largest mosque in Northeast India, known for its glass architecture, housing an orphanage, Islamic institute, and a separate prayer hall for women.

religious_places.name: Ramakrishna Mission Ashram
religious_places.description: A spiritual center with a modest temple dedicated to Sri Ramakrishna, featuring a museum on local tribal culture and evening prayers by students.

religious_places.name: All Saints Church
religious_places.description: A historic Anglican church rebuilt in 1902 after an 1897 earthquake, known for its elegant carvings, stained glass, and serene wooden interiors.

religious_places.name: Mahadev Khola Dham
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, set inside a cave near the Bangladesh border, popular during Shivratri for its spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Church of Epiphany
religious_places.description: A Presbyterian church in the cleanest village in Asia, built in 1902, known for its European architecture and peaceful surroundings.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Sri Guru Singh Sabha
religious_places.description: A prominent Sikh gurdwara in Shillong, serving as a spiritual and community center for the Sikh population, known for its serene ambiance.

religious_places.name: Matri Mandir (Ramna Kalibari)
religious_places.description: A 1000-year-old Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kali, known for its unique architecture and vibrant Diwali celebrations with lights and flowers.

religious_places.name: Nongsawlia Church
religious_places.description: A historic Presbyterian church established in 1848, known for its historical architecture and significance as a center of early Christianity in the region.

religious_places.name: Laitumkhrah Presbyterian Church
religious_places.description: A prominent Presbyterian church in Shillong, known for its serene ambiance and historical significance, blending Khasi and Christian traditions.

religious_places.name: Sai Baba Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Sai Baba, located near a lake, known for its tranquil setting and spiritual ambiance, accessible via National Highway 6.

religious_places.name: Mairang Presbyterian Church
religious_places.description: A 19th-century church built by Welsh missionaries, blending Khasi and colonial architectural styles, serving as a beacon of faith in the region.

religious_places.name: Mawphlang Sacred Grove
religious_places.description: A sacred forest revered by the Khasi community for its spiritual significance, preserved for centuries, home to sacred plants and monoliths.

religious_places.name: Solomon's Temple
religious_places.description: A grand Christian church, known as Kohhran Thianghlim in Mizo, built with white marble, accommodating 2,000 inside and 10,000 in its courtyard, a major spiritual and tourist site.

religious_places.name: Mizoram Presbyterian Church Synod
religious_places.description: The largest Christian denomination in Mizoram, established by Welsh missionaries in the late 19th century, known for its geometric architecture and cultural significance.

religious_places.name: Lunglei Bazar Veng Baptist Church
religious_places.description: One of the oldest Baptist churches in Mizoram, known for its unique architecture and revered as a sacred place by the local community.

religious_places.name: Shiv Mandir
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, maintained by the local Gorkha community, located in a serene neighborhood with stairs leading up to the shrine.

religious_places.name: Roman Catholic Diocese of Aizawl
religious_places.description: A prominent Catholic church established in 1952, known for its contributions to education and healthcare, serving the spiritual needs of the local Catholic community.

religious_places.name: Salvation Army Church
religious_places.description: A serene Christian church offering Bible reading sessions and community activities, popular for Sunday gatherings and its peaceful ambiance.

religious_places.name: Evangelical Church of Maraland
religious_places.description: One of the oldest churches in Mizoram, founded in 1907, known for its Gothic architecture and significance to the Mara people in southern Mizoram.

religious_places.name: Ngaizel Presbyterian Church
religious_places.description: An architectural marvel among Mizoram’s churches, known for its spiritual significance and serene setting, offering a place for contemplation and worship.

religious_places.name: Mission Vengthlang Church
religious_places.description: A prominent Christian church in Aizawl, known for its community engagement and regular worship services, attracting both locals and visitors.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid Aizawl
religious_places.description: A key mosque serving the small Muslim community in Mizoram, offering a peaceful place for prayers and community gatherings in the capital city.

religious_places.name: Kohima Cathedral
religious_places.description: Also known as the Cathedral of Reconciliation, this Catholic cathedral on Aradura Hill is one of the largest in Northeast India, known for its unique architecture and serene surroundings.

religious_places.name: Dimapur Ao Baptist Church
religious_places.description: A prominent Baptist church under the Nagaland Baptist Church Council, featuring a large prayer hall and serving as a spiritual hub for the Ao Naga community.

religious_places.name: Dimapur Kalibari
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kali, built in 1956, known for its vibrant Durga Puja celebrations and community services like an ambulance and library.

religious_places.name: Dimapur Jain Temple
religious_places.description: Built in 1947 by the Sethi families, this temple dedicated to Lord Mahavira features intricate glasswork and serves as a spiritual haven for the Jain community.

religious_places.name: Sumi Baptist Church
religious_places.description: One of Asia’s largest churches by capacity, rebuilt in 2018 at 1,865 meters, serving as the headquarters for Sumi Baptists and hosting the Tuluni harvest festival.

religious_places.name: Shiv Temple Singrijan
religious_places.description: A popular Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, attracting devotees especially during Maha Shivratri, despite Nagaland’s Christian majority.

religious_places.name: Kohima Kalibari Temple
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kali, reflecting the devotion of the local community and offering a tranquil space for worship.

religious_places.name: Wokha Town Temple
religious_places.description: A significant Hindu temple in Wokha, reflecting the vibrant religious life of the Lotha tribe and their participation in local festivals.

religious_places.name: Sai Baba Temple
religious_places.description: A serene sanctuary dedicated to Shirdi Sai Baba, promoting universal messages of love and compassion, attracting diverse devotees.

religious_places.name: ISKCON Temple Dimapur
religious_places.description: A temple promoting the teachings of Lord Krishna, known for its vibrant deity worship, kirtans, and Bhagavad Gita lectures.

religious_places.name: Jagannath Temple Kohima
religious_places.description: A Hindu temple modeled after the Puri Jagannath Temple, hosting the annual Rath Yatra and serving as a cultural and spiritual hub.

religious_places.name: Ramakrishna Mission Dimapur
religious_places.description: A spiritual and community center embodying Swami Vivekananda’s teachings, offering meditation, worship, and charitable initiatives.

religious_places.name: Village Baptist Church Wokha
religious_places.description: A key Baptist church serving the Lotha Naga community, known for its role in local worship and community gatherings.

religious_places.name: St. Paul’s Church Pungro
religious_places.description: A Christian church in the remote Kiphire district, serving as a spiritual center for the local community with a focus on faith and fellowship.

religious_places.name: Heraka Shrine Khezakeno
religious_places.description: A sacred site for the Heraka faith, followed by the Zeliangrong tribe, preserving indigenous animist traditions and cultural heritage.

religious_places.name: Jagannath Temple
religious_places.description: A major Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Jagannath, part of the Char Dham, famous for its annual Rath Yatra and intricate Kalinga architecture.

religious_places.name: Lingaraj Temple
religious_places.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its 54-meter-high spire and Kalinga architecture, a key spiritual center in Odisha.

religious_places.name: Konark Sun Temple
religious_places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this 13th-century Hindu temple dedicated to the Sun God is designed as a colossal chariot with intricate stone carvings.

religious_places.name: Dhauli Shanti Stupa
religious_places.description: A Buddhist peace pagoda built by the Japanese, near the site of Emperor Ashoka’s Kalinga War, symbolizing peace and featuring ancient rock edicts.

religious_places.name: Mukteshwar Temple
religious_places.description: A 10th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, renowned for its gem-like architecture and intricate carvings, a masterpiece of Kalinga style.

religious_places.name: Jama Masjid
religious_places.description: A historic mosque in Cuttack, serving as a central place of worship for the Muslim community, known for its serene ambiance and traditional architecture.

religious_places.name: Gurudwara Guru Nanak Datan Sahib
religious_places.description: A Sikh gurdwara commemorating Guru Nanak’s visit, known for its peaceful environment and historical significance for the Sikh community.

religious_places.name: Ratnagiri Buddhist Monastery
religious_places.description: An ancient Buddhist site, part of the Puspagiri University complex, known for its stupas, monasteries, and intricately carved sculptures.

religious_places.name: Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves
religious_places.description: Ancient Jain caves from the 2nd century BCE, featuring rock-cut shelters and intricate carvings, significant for Jain monks and pilgrims.

religious_places.name: St. Vincent’s Church
religious_places.description: A historic Christian church known for its serene ambiance and colonial architecture, serving the local Christian community in southern Odisha.

religious_places.name: Rajarani Temple
religious_places.description: An 11th-century Hindu temple, often called the 'love temple' for its erotic carvings, showcasing exquisite Kalinga architecture.

religious_places.name: Qadam-e-Rasool
religious_places.description: A revered Muslim shrine believed to house a footprint of Prophet Muhammad, attracting devotees for its spiritual significance.

religious_places.name: Ananta Vasudeva Temple
religious_places.description: A 13th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Krishna, known for its detailed carvings and historical importance in Kalinga architecture.

religious_places.name: Lalitgiri Buddhist Complex
religious_places.description: An ancient Buddhist site with stupas, monasteries, and sculptures, part of the Puspagiri University, significant for its archaeological value.

religious_places.name: Parsurameshwara Temple
religious_places.description: A 7th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, one of the oldest in Bhubaneswar, known for its early Kalinga architectural style.
